newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Yugo president nominates cenbank governor - agency.
newsitem.headline: Yugo president nominates cenbank governor - agency.

text.p: Yugoslav President Zoran Lilic nominated on Tuesday the Serbian finance minister Dusan Vlatkovic for the post of the governor of the Yugoslav National Bank (NBY), Tanjug newsagency reported.
Lilic submitted Vlatkovic's nomination to the parliament which meets on Thursday.
Vlatkovic is a close ally of the Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic.
The central bank governor post has been vacant since May 1996, when the majority Socialists federal parliament ousted a 78-year old Dragoslav Avramovic over his maverick stands.
Avramovic gained fame for halting the country's hyperinflation of 60 percent a day in 1994 and his persistent refusal to print money, which put him at loggerheads with the ruling party.

The NBY Deputy Governor Bozidar Gazivoda, appointed Yugoslav finance minister in March this year, has been acting as central bank governor since then. -- Gordana Kukic, Belgrade Newsroom +381 11 222 4254
